pullRequest.body:
This is the `ChartedSpace` analogue of `contMDiffOn_extChartAt` and `contMDiffOn_extChartAt_symm`; proving this revealed a few gaps in other API. This may be useful for showing open subsets of a manifold are submanifolds.

--------------

- [x] depends on: #9238
- [x] depends on: #9632
- [x] depends on: #10083
- [x] depends on: #10082

nodes.body: I only looked at and golfed one lemma so far, but I like the spirit of this PR! It'll likely come in handy when we define open submanifolds.
FYI, I made #9802 which renamed a couple things. Should be very quick to review and will lead to some renames in this PR as well.

> I only looked at and golfed one lemma so far, but I like the spirit of this PR! It'll likely come in handy when we define open submanifolds.

I always thought this PR was not useful for that (as we'd extended charts), but I'm happy to be proven wrong :-) Your idea is to argue that an open submanifold is (locally) given as the image under a chart, i.e. a structomorphism, right? That could certainly work. (I don't know if it's the nicest approach, but we will see.)

I gave some minor style comments.

RFC: #9894 changes `[Nonempty s]` to an explicit `(hs : Nonempty s)` in `subtypeRestr` and removes `@... _ _ _ _` and `haveI := ...` when it is used.
Thank you for all the comments! I have adapted the code accordingly (and find them quite a bit cleaner).
Can you merge master once #9894 is in?
Let me also wait for #9632 (approved), #10083 and a decision on #10082 --- all of these are going to conflict with this one.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9238~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9632~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10083~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10082~~

bors d+
Thanks!

```suggestion
    (e.subtypeRestr s).symm â‰«â‚• e'.subtypeRestr s âˆˆ G := 
  G.eq_on_source (closedUnderRestriction' (G.compatible he he') (e.isOpen_inter_preimage_symm s.2))
    (e.subtypeRestr_symm_trans_subtypeRestr s e')
```
Golfed a bit.
Is it helpful to invoke type class inference in `[Nonempty s]`? `s` is some subset, which in general is unlikely to have an instance. My hunch is to write instead `(hs : Set.Nonempty s)`.
Well, `subtypeRestr` requires an argument `[Nonempty s]`, which is why I'm also using this form...

My doubts extend to `subtypeRestr`. In `ChartedSpace.lean`, the only place so far where it's used, you see `Nonempty` instance needing to be constructed manually, such as `@PartialHomeomorph.subtypeRestr _ _ _ _ (chartAt H x.1) s âŸ¨xâŸ©` in [TopologicalSpace.Opens.instChartedSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Manifold/ChartedSpace.html#TopologicalSpace.Opens.instChartedSpace) and `haveI : Nonempty U := âŸ¨xâŸ©` in [TopologicalSpace.Opens.chartAt_inclusion_symm_eventuallyEq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Manifold/ChartedSpace.html#TopologicalSpace.Opens.chartAt_inclusion_symm_eventuallyEq). I think I'll open a PR changing the instance argument to an explicit one.
Sounds good. If that PR is approved, I'll update mine accordingly.
One suggestion: `restriction_mem_maximalAtlas_subtype`

Minor points: dot notation
```suggestion
    (hs : e.source.Nonempty) [HasGroupoid M G] [ClosedUnderRestriction G] :
```

Minor spacing:
```suggestion
    let t := { carrier := e.target, is_open' := e.open_target : Opens H };
```

```suggestion
      e.toHomeomorphSourceTarget.toPartialHomeomorph â‰«â‚• c' âˆˆ G.maximalAtlas s := by
```

```suggestion
  let goal := e.toHomeomorphSourceTarget.toPartialHomeomorph â‰«â‚• t.partialHomeomorphSubtypeCoe
```

Golf a bit. Feel free to revert if you feel the original one was a clearer presentation.
```suggestion
    have : IsEmpty t := isEmpty_coe_sort.mpr
      (by convert e.image_source_eq_target â–¸ image_eq_empty.mpr h)
```

I'm not sure what the preferred style is, but coming from mathlib3 my expectation is no dangling curly brackets:
```suggestion
    exact { Homeomorph.empty with
      -- `c'` cannot exist: it would be the restriction of `chartAt H x` at some `x âˆˆ t`.
      mem_groupoid := fun _ c' _ âŸ¨_, âŸ¨x, _âŸ©, _âŸ© â†¦ (this.false x).elim }
```
I have adopted your suggestion. I don't see this mentioned in the style guide and would welcome a comment here.

Turns out the `show` is not needed to compile, but feel free to keep it if it's conceptually clearer. Also, `apply` -> `exact` on closing line.
```suggestion
        -- The atlas of H on itself has only one chart, hence c' is the inclusion.
        -- Then, compatibility of `G` *almost* yields our claim --- except that `e` is a chart
        -- on `M` and `c` is one on `s`: we need to show that restricting `e` to `s` and composing
        -- with `c'` yields a chart in the maximal atlas of `s`.
        exact G.compatible_of_mem_maximalAtlas (G.subset_maximalAtlas hc)
          (G.restriction_chart he (nmem_singleton_empty.mp h) c' hc')
```

```suggestion
  Â· exact { e.toHomeomorphSourceTarget with
      mem_groupoid :=
        -- The atlas of H on itself has only one chart, hence c' is the inclusion.
        -- Then, compatibility of `G` *almost* yields our claim --- except that `e` is a chart
        -- on `M` and `c` is one on `s`: we need to show that restricting `e` to `s` and composing
        -- with `c'` yields a chart in the maximal atlas of `s`.
        fun c c' hc hc' â†¦ G.compatible_of_mem_maximalAtlas (G.subset_maximalAtlas hc)
          (G.restriction_mem_maximalAtlas_subtype he h c' hc') }
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: charts are structomorphisms

source.title: feat: extended charts are local diffeomorphisms on their source
